intro: Moraea gracilenta, commonly known as the slender moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance.
